Investigators indicated these notes are in opposition of highway signs urging motorists to report suspicious activity. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack was to show opposition to highway signs that urge motorists to report suspicious activity.

Summary: 01/06/2011: On Thursday, in Hanover, Maryland, United States, a package was sent to Transportation Secretary Beverly Swaim-Staley. The package was one of two received on the same day, the other was sent to Governor Martin O'Malley. The package was opened by a government employee, subsequently ignited and burned the employee's fingers. No other casualties took place. Explosive material was not found in the package but a small battery and an electric match which ignited the material were recovered. The same note was found in both of the packages as well, stating "Report suspicious activity! Total Bull----! You have created a self fulfilling prophecy." Investigators indicated these notes are in opposition of highway signs urging motorists to report suspicious activity. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack was to show opposition to highway signs that urge motorists to report suspicious activity.

Summary: 01/07/2011: On Friday, in Washington, District of Columbia, United States, an envelope addressed to Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano ignited at a postal sorting facility. The envelope was not opened and therefore did not cause any casualties or property damage. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Target: The target of the attack was Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack was to intimidate the American government.

Summary: 01/17/2011: On Monday morning at 0925, at the northeast corner of North Washington Street and West Main Avenue in downtown Spokane, Washington, a backpack containing an improvised explosive device (IED) was found on a Martin Luther King Jr. march bus route. Authorities safely disposed of the IED, there were no casualties or damages. In March 2011, Kevin Harpham, who has ties to the white supremacist organization National Alliance, was arrested in connection with the attack. He confessed to planting the bomb and was sentenced to 32 years in prison in December 2011.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.

Summary: 02/22/2011: An arson attack occurred at 4:00 a.m. targeting a townhouse under construction in the East Hills neighborhood of Grand Rapids, Michigan, United States. At the time of the arson, area residents received a letter claiming responsibility for the attack, demanding a return to low-income housing in the area, and indicating that additional attacks will take place. The letter was signed "The Old Neighbors."
Motive: Anti-gentrification

Summary: 04/23/2011: On Saturday night at 0300, in Stockton, California, United States, unidentified assailants set fire to the Masjid Al Emaan Mosque. The motive of the crime is unknown, and the monetary damages are estimated to be about $400,000. The mosque and the Reliance Real Estate building were completely destroyed in the attack. The attack caused no casualties and no group or individual has claimed responsibility.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.

Summary: 05/06/2011: On Friday afternoon at 1400, near Third and Reaney Streets under the Commodore Barry Bridge in the city of Chester on the outskirts of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States, local law enforcement officials discovered an improvised explosive device near Amtrak and Septa railroad tracks. The device, which consisted of two bottles with an unknown yellow liquid, wire and a timer attached with duct tape, was safely defused by the bomb squad preventing any casualties or property damage from taking place. No group has claimed responsibility and authorities have not disclosed the suspected motive of the attempted attack.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.

Summary: 09/26/2011: On Monday morning, in Caldwell, Idaho, United States, animal rights activists drilled a hole into the storage space of Rocky Mountain Fur and Fireworks, pumped several gallons of fuel into and set fire to the retail building. There were no injuries, but the fire caused $100,000 in damage. A group calling themselves “the Arson Unit” sent a message to the North American Animal Liberation Press Office in Los Angeles, California, United States and the BiteBack Magazine website claiming responsibility for the arson. The “Arson Unit” is believed to be a branch of the Animal Liberation Front (ALF).
Target: The Rocky Mountain Fur and Fireworks retail building located in Caldwell, Idaho, United States
Motive: The specific motive for the attack was to stop the killing of animals for their fur.

Summary: 10/12/2011: On Wednesday morning, in Gifford, Washington, United States, animal rights activists entered Miller’s Mink Ranch located on Addy-Gifford Road and took down every breeder card in one of the two large, main sheds. They opened approximately three quarters of the cages, freeing more than one thousand animals. The activists also kidnapped three individuals and released them at different locations later that day, which were not reported. A communiqué detailing the incident was released to the BiteBack Magazine website, but no group has claimed responsibility.
Motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.

Summary: 11/11/2011: Oscar Ramiro Ortega-Hernandez fired at least eight rounds of ammuntion from a semi-automatic assault rifle at The White House in Washington, DC, United States, striking the executive mansion about eight times and causing approximately $100,000 in damage. The President and the First Lady were both out of the area at the time of the incident. Ortega-Hernandez, who is not linked to any organizations, pleaded guilty to charges related to the incident and was sentenced to 25 years in prison in April 2014. The Federal Bureau of Investigation indicates that he was motivated by anti-government sentiment; sources also report that he suffered from paranoia.
Motive: The perpetrator was motivated by anti-government sentiment.

Summary: 01/01/2012: An assailant threw an incendiary device at the American Family Planning clinic in Pensacola, Florida, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An individual, identified as Bobby Joe Rogers, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack due to his anti-abortion beliefs.
Motive: An individual, identified as Bobby Joe Rogers, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack due to his anti-abortion beliefs.

Summary: 01/01/2012: An assailant threw two incendiary devices at a house used for Hindu worship services in Queens, New York City, United States. The devices fizzled out before catching fire. This was one of four arson attacks in Queens on this date. Ray Lazier Lengend was arrested and claimed responsibility for the series of incidents.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, police were investigating the series of four attacks in New York City as hate crimes.

Summary: 01/01/2012: An assailant threw three incendiary devices at the Imam Al-Khoei Foundation in Queens, New York City, United States. The devices caused minimal damage to the building. This was one of four arson attacks in Queens on this date. Ray Lazier Lengend was arrested and claimed responsibility for the series of incidents.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, police were investigating the series of four attacks in New York City as hate crimes.

Summary: 01/01/2012: An assailant threw an incendiary device at a house in Queens, New York City, United States. The fire caused extensive damage to the house. This was one of four arson attacks in Queens on this date. Ray Lazier Lengend was arrested and claimed responsibility for the series of incidents.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, police were investigating the series of four attacks in New York City as hate crimes.

Summary: 01/01/2012: An assailant threw an incendiary device at a bodega in Queens, New York City, United States. Damages were reported, but their extent is unknown. This was one of four arson attacks in Queens on this date. Ray Lazier Lengend was arrested and claimed responsibility for the series of incidents.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, police were investigating the series of four attacks in New York City as hate crimes.

Summary: 01/03/2012: An assailant used gasoline to set fire to a Jewish temple in Paramus, New Jersey, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, Anthony M. Graziano was arrested and charged in connection with the incident.

01/08/2012: An assailant opened fire on businesses near the intersection of 27th Street and West Meighan Boulevard in Alabama City, Alabama, United States. The assailant opened fire on responding officers and a clash and police chase ensued. The officers apprehended the assailant and there were no reported casualties. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Luis Ibarra-Hernandez, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in order to "draw attention to Islam."
Motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Luis Ibarra-Hernandez, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in order to "draw attention to Islam."

Summary: 01/11/2012: Assailants threw incendiary devices at Temple Beth El on Montross Avenue in Rutherford, New Jersey, United States. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, Anthony M. Graziano and Aakash Dalal were arrested and charged in connection with the incident.

04/01/2012: An assailant set fire to a Planned Parenthood clinic in Grand Chute, Wisconsin, United States. There were no casualties, and the clinic reopened two days later. Francis Grady claimed responsibility for this attack.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the attacker, Francis Grady, self-identified as pro-life and had previously protested multiple times in front of the targeted Planned Parenthood clinic.

Summary: 05/20/2012: Assailants set fire to the Atlanta Gynecology and Obstetrics clinic in Lilburn, Georgia, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the attack may have been related to recent debates regarding an abortion law.

Summary: 05/20/2012: Assailants set fire to the New Holy Deliverance Outreach Ministry in Axton, Virginia, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An individual, identified as Jean-Claude Bridges, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he targeted the church because the congregation was predominantly African American.
Motive: An individual, identified as Jean-Claude Bridges, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he targeted New Holy Deliverance Outreach Ministry because the church’s congregation was predominantly African American.

Summary: 05/23/2012: Assailants set fire to the Alpha OB/GYN clinic in Marietta, Georgia, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the owner of Alpha OB/GYN clinic is known for providing abortions.

Summary: 06/18/2012: An assailant attempted to bomb a natural gas pipeline in Plano, Texas, United States. The assailant was critically injured when the explosive device detonated prematurely. Additionally, the pipeline was also damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources note that Anson Chi identified as part of the anti-government Sovereign Citizen movement.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, the assailant, Anson Chi, had posted YouTube videos and blog entries describing his dislike for the government and the police.

Summary: 07/04/2012: An assailant threw an incendiary device onto the roof of a mosque owned by the Islamic Society of Joplin in Joplin, Missouri, United States. No casualties were reported in the attack; however, the roof was damaged. This same mosque was later destroyed by arson on August 6, 2012. On October 19, 2012, Jedediah Stout was arrested and confessed to both of the arson attacks on the Joplin mosque. He stated that he targeted the mosque because he disliked Islam.
Motive: Jedediah Stout, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he targeted the mosque because he was opposed to Islam.

Summary: 08/05/2012: An assailant opened fire on a Sikh temple in Oak Creek, Wisconsin, United States. At least seven people were killed and three other people were injured before the assailant was shot by a responding police officer and subsequently died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources identifed the assailant, Wade Michael Page, as a member of a white supremacist organization.

08/06/2012: Assailants set fire to a mosque owned by the Islamic Society of Joplin in Joplin, Missouri, United States. No one was hurt or killed in the attack, but the mosque was destroyed. Jedediah Stout was arrested and confessed to the arson, stating that he targeted the mosque because he disliked Islam.
Motive: An individual, identified as Jedediah Stout, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he targeted the mosque because he disliked Islam.

Summary: 08/12/2012: Assailants threw an explosive device containing acid and other chemicals at the College Preparatory School of America, an Islamic school, in Lombard, Illinois, United States. There were no casualties or property damage reported in this incident. No group claimed responsibility for this attack.

08/15/2012: An assailant opened fire on a security guard at the offices of the Family Research Council in Washington, District of Columbia (DC), United States. One security guard was wounded in the attack; the assailant was arrested. Floyd Corkins claimed responsibility for the attack, stating that he targeted the Family Research Council because of the organization's opposition to gay marriage and gay rights.
Motive: In a guilty plea entered in court as part of a plea agreement, Floyd Corkins stated that he targeted the Family Research Council because of the organization's opposition to gay marriage and gay rights.

Summary: 09/30/2012: Randolph T. Linn set fire to the area where men pray in the main room of the Islamic Center of Greater Toledo in Perrysburg, Ohio, United States. Sprinklers were able to douse the fire, but significant damage to the center was done. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2012: A small incendiary device exploded at the entrance of a Social Security Administration building in Casa Grande, Arizona, United States. No one was injured in the blast, although the building was slightly damaged. An Iraqi civilian, Abdullatif Ali Aldosary, was taken into custody in connection with the incident.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, the man who was taken into custody for the attack had been denied a green card due to his anti-government activities in Iraq.

Summary: 01/17/2013: An explosive device detonated outside of the Tacoma Community Justice Center in Tacoma, Washington, United States. There were no damages or injuries resulting from the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2013: An assailant opened fire on two Riverside police officers in Corona, California, United States. One police officer died and the other officer was wounded in the asault. The perpetrator, Christopher Dorner, posted a lengthy statement online detailing his grievances, including both his personal frustrations regarding his dismissal from the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) as well as what he viewed as excessive use of force and racism in policing. This attack took place in the context of an extensive manhunt for Dorner, who carried out an initial attack on February 3 against targets he selected in retaliation for the decision to fire him. Following the manhunt, police located and surrounded Dorner in a remote cabin where he had died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Motive: Prior to the incident, ex-Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) officer Christopher Dorner claimed responsibility in an online manifesto, stating that he was engaging in a war on the LAPD for their alleged corruption and injustice towards racial minorities.

Summary: 02/25/2013: Assailants set fire to a construction site in Seattle, Washington, the United States. There were no casualties, but the fire caused $60,000 in damages. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the attack, stating that they started the fire to protest what they called the myth of sustainable development.
Motive: In a letter posted online, Anarchists claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the constructions site was targeted in protest of sustainable development.

Summary: 04/15/2013: An explosive device consisting of a pressure cooker, nails, BBs, and a detonator fashioned from the remote control of a toy car detonated near the finish line of the Boston Marathon on Boylston Street in the Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. This was one of two similar bombs that detonated approximately 12 seconds and 100 yards apart. The detonation of the first device, which was located near Marathon Sports, killed spectator Krystle Campbell. Approximately 264 others were wounded in the two attacks. The alleged assailants of the blasts were later identified as Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, brothers who immigrated to the United States from Russia in 2002 and 2003. On April 19, 2013, as part of an attempt to flee the Boston area, the assailants were involved in a shootout with police that resulted in the death of Tamerlan Tsarnaev. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was arrested later that evening after he was discovered hiding in a boat that was parked in a Watertown, Massachusetts resident's backyard. Tsarnaev had written a claim of responsibility on the side of the boat. On July 10, 2013, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev pleaded not guilty to 30 federal counts related to the attack, including one for the use of a weapon of mass destruction. Tsarnaev was ultimately found guilty on all counts, and sentenced to the death penalty on June 24, 2015.
Motive: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to his belief that the United States (US) was allegedly killing innocent members of the Muslim community.

Summary: 04/15/2013: An explosive device consisting of a pressure cooker, nails, BBs, and a detonator fashioned from the remote control of a toy car went off near the finish line of the Boston Marathon on Boylston Street in the Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. This was one of two similar bombs that detonated approximately 12 seconds and 100 yards apart. The detonation of second device, which was located near Forum Restaurant, killed spectators Martin Richard and Lingzi Lu. Approximately 264 others were wounded in the two attacks. The alleged assailants of the blasts were later identified as Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, brothers who immigrated to the United States from Russia in 2002 and 2003. On April 19, 2013, as part of an attempt to flee the Boston area, the assailants were involved in a shootout with police that resulted in the death of Tamerlan Tsarnaev. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was arrested later that evening after he was discovered hiding in a boat that was parked in a Watertown, Massachusetts resident's backyard. Tsarnaev had written a claim of responsibility on the side of the boat. On July 10, 2013, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev pleaded not guilty to 30 federal counts related to the attack, including one for the use of a weapon of mass destruction. Tsarnaev was ultimately found guilty on all counts, and sentenced to the death penalty on June 24, 2015.
Motive: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to his belief that the United States (US) was allegedly killing innocent members of the Muslim community.

Summary: 04/16/2013: Assailants opened fire on the Metcalf transmission substation after severing telecommunication wires in San Jose, California, United States. As a result, 17 transformers that supplied power to Silicon Valley were damaged, causing them to leak 52,000 gallons of oil. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/17/2013: Assailants set fire to the West Fertilizer Company plant in West, Texas, United States. The subsequent explosion killed 15 people and injured at least an additional 151. No group claimed responsibility for the attack. On May 11, 2016 investigators announced that the fire was set intentionally; however, no suspects were announced.

04/18/2013: A Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) police officer, Sean Collier, was shot and killed by gunmen on the MIT campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States. The suspected assailants of the attack were later identified as Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who are believed to also be responsible for the double bomb attack near the finish line of the Boston Marathon that took place on April 15, 2013. Shortly after the killing of Collier, the suspects were involved in a shootout with police as they attempted to flee the Boston area. Tamerlan Tsarnaev was killed in the firefight. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was arrested later that evening after he was discovered hiding in a boat that was parked in a Watertown, Massachusetts resident's backyard. Tsarnaev had written a claim of responsibility on the side of the boat. On July 10, 2013, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev pleaded not guilty to 30 federal counts related to the killing of Collier and the marathon attacks.
Motive: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to his belief that the United States (US) was allegedly killing innocent members of the Muslim community.

Summary: 04/18/2013: An explosive device was discovered at the airport in McCook, Nebraska, United States. The device was safely defused without incident. No group claimed responsibility for the unsuccessful attack.

04/19/2013: Police thwarted a potential bomb attack when they engaged in a firefight with the alleged assailants of the Boston Marathon bombings, Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, in Watertown, Massachusetts, United States. It was later revealed that the Tsarnaev brothers were plotting to use the explosives to carry out an attack in an unconfirmed location. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was arrested later that evening after he was discovered hiding in a boat that was parked in a Watertown, Massachusetts, resident's backyard. Tsarnaev had written a claim of responsibility on the side of the boat. On July 10, 2013, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev pleaded not guilty to 30 federal counts related to the Boston attacks, including one for the use of a weapon of mass destruction.
Motive: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to his belief that the United States (US) was allegedly killing innocent members of the Muslim community.

The assailant was identified as Bryan Isaack Clyde and sources noted that he had posted several anti-government and incel-related memes on social media in the weeks and months leading up to the attack.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Bryan Isaack Clyde had conveyed anti-government rhetoric on social media.

Summary: 06/17/2019: Assailants set fire to a LGBTQ-Pride Month display at the United Christian Church in Renton, Washington, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected an anti-LGBT extremist.

06/19/2019: Assailants detonated explosives at a Pride Month display outside United Christian Church in Renton, Washington, United States. There were no reported casualties, but the display was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the assailants wrote "Leviticus 20:13" at the scene.
Motive: Anti-LGBT extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote "Leviticus 20:1," which states "If a man also lie with mankind, as he lieth with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them."

Summary: 06/20/2019: Assailants lured a gay man from the dating website Grindr and attacked him in Atkins, Arkansas, United States. The man was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shield Wall Network (SWN).
Motive: Members of the Shield Wall Network (SWN) claimed responsibility for the incident in a call to police after the incident claiming that they apprehended some one in a "child-predator sting." Sources noted that the assailants had a history of neo-Nazi and white supremacist social media posts.

Summary: 06/24/2019: An assailants set fire to Queen Sheba Ethiopian restaurant in Sacramento, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2019: An assailant armed with incendiary devices and a firearm attacked the Northwest Detention Center along 1600 East J Street in Tacoma, Washington, United States. The assailant threw incendiary devices at vehicles and attempted to set fire to buildings and a propane tank before being shot and killed by officers at the facility. Willem Van Spronsen, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that "detention camps are an abomination."
Motive: Willem Van Spronsen, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that "detention camps are an abomination."

Summary: 07/28/2019: An assailant opened fire on attendees at the Gilroy Garlic Festival at Christmas Hill Park in Gilroy, California, United States. Three people were killed and 17 other people were injured in the assault. The assailant was shot and killed by police officers responding to the attack. Santino William Legan, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote on social media prior to the attack, "Read Might is Right by Ragnar Redbeard. Why overcrowd towns and pave more open space to make room for hordes of mestizos and Silicon Valley white tw**s?"
Motive: Santino William Legan, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote on social media prior to the attack, "Read Might is Right by Ragnar Redbeard. Why overcrowd towns and pave more open space to make room for hordes of mestizos and Silicon Valley white tw**s?"

Summary: 07/28/2019: An assailant shot a civilian outside of the Young Israel of Greater Miami synagogue along Northeast 171 Street in Miami, Florida, United States. The civilian was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to an anti-Semitic extremist. Authorities arrested Carlints St. Louis in connection with the incident.

08/03/2019: An assailant, armed with a WASR-10 rifle, opened fire on civilians inside a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, United States. At least 23 people were killed and 24 other people were injured in the assault. The victims included United States, Mexican, and German nationals. Authorities arrested the assailant, identified as Patrick Crusius, who claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was targeting Mexicans. Crusius also published a manifesto prior to the attack where he decried a "Hispanic invasion of Texas" and cited the Christchurch, New Zealand shooter as an inspiration.
Motive: Patrick Crusius, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and in his manifesto stated that he targeted members of the Latinx community citing economic reasons and further stating "My whole life I have been preparing for a future that currently doesn’t exist. The job of my dreams will likely be automated. Hispanics will take control of the local and state government of my beloved Texas, changing policy to better suit their needs." Moreover, he wrote "I am against race mixing because it destroys genetic diversity and creates identity problems. Also because it’s completely unnecessary and selfish." He also cited the manifesto of Brenton Tarrant, the perpetrator of the Christchurch, New Zealand attack as inspiration.

Summary: 08/04/2019: An assailant, armed with an assault-style firearm, opened fire on civilians outside the Ned Peppers bar along East 5th street in Dayton, Ohio, United States. At least 10 people, including the assailant, were killed and 27 other people were injured in the attack. The assailant's sister was among the victims. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities identified the assailant as Connor Stephen Betts. Sources noted that although Betts identified himself as a leftist and had "an obsession with violence and mass shootings," he did not have a racial or political motive for carrying out the attack.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Connor Stephen Betts had posted "extreme left-wing and anti-police posts, as well as tweets supporting Antifa, or anti-fascist, protesters" on Twitter. Sources also noted that Betts "had an obsession with violence and mass shootings."

Summary: 08/06/2019: Assailants attempted to set fire to the residence of an interracial couple, identified as Brad and Angela Frase, by filling the house with natural gas and leaving the stove burner on in Sterling, Ohio, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of two similar attacks within 24 hours. White supremacists claimed responsibility by spray-painting racial slurs and a swastika on a garage and vehicles at the scene of the attack.
Target: Residence of Civilians: Brad Frase, Angela Frase
Motive: White extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and spray-painted racial slurs and a swastika on a garage and vehicles at the scene of the attack.

Summary: 08/07/2019: Assailants set fire to the residence of an interracial couple in Sterling, Ohio, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of two similar attacks within 24 hours. White supremacists claimed responsibility by spray-painting racial slurs and a swastika on a garage and vehicles at the scene of the attack.
Target: House of Civilians: Brad Frase, Angela Frase
Motive: White extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and spray-painted racial slurs and a swastika on a garage and vehicles at the scene of the attack.

Summary: 08/10/2019: An assailant armed with pepper spray was arrested outside XS Nightclub at Encore Casino along Las Vegas Boulevard in Las Vegas, Nevada, United States. The assailant and one other person had been removed from the club earlier that morning for holding their fists in the air while yelling white supremacist remarks and threatening to open fire inside the club. There were no reported casualties in the incident. Johnny Young and Braxton Ryback claimed responsibility and stated "white privilege, white power, we are white supremacists."
Motive: Johnny Young and Braxton Ryback, unaffiliated individuals, claimed repsonsibility for the incident and stated "white privilege, white power, we are white supremacists." Sources noted that Young and Ryback were charged "with one count each of making false threats in an act of terrorism."

Summary: 08/13/2019: An assailant opened fire on Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) offices in San Antonio, Texas, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2019: An assailant set fire to a Jehovah's Witness Kingdom Hall in Puyallup, Washington, United States. There were no reported casualties but the building was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2019: Assailants opened fire on the Salem African Methodist Episcopal Church in Graceville, Florida, United States. There were no reported casualties, though the church was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, two individuals were arrested in connection with the attack.

10/27/2019: Assailants set a fire inside Station Church in North Hornell, New York, United States. No casualties were reported, but the church was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2019: Seven armed assailants, claiming to represent Native Americans, attacked a residential community clubhouse in Pine Ridge, Pennsylvania, United States. One security officer was taken hostage and released later that day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
Motive: An unknown group claiming to be indigenous Native Americans claimed responsibility for the incident and stated they wanted to "take back" their land. However, authorities doubted the veracity of their claim.

Summary: 11/20/2019: Assailants stabbed and beat an Orthodox Jewish man outside the Toshnad Heichel Torah Utfila Synagogue in Spring Valley, New York, United States. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources identified the assailant as Grafton E. Thomas.

11/20/2019: An assailant stabbed and injured a woman wearing a fur coat (or boots) along Fairmount boulevard at Fairmount Presbyterian Church in Cleveland Heights, Ohio, United States. The assailant, identified as an animal rights extremist, had a history of attacking people wearing fur and had said “she wanted to set up an animal rights militia.” Sources also noted that it remained unknown if the victim was wearing real fur.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the victim was targeted because the assailant thought she was wearing fur.

Summary: 12/05/2019: Assailants broke into and started fires inside St.Thomas Aquinas church in El Paso, Texas, United States. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/05/2019: Assailants set fire to a cell tower along 118 Neil Street in Hayden Place neighborhood, Memphis, Tennessee, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two incidents targeting towers in Memphis on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

Summary: 12/05/2019: Assailants set fire to a cell tower along Faxon avenue in Binghampton neighborhood, Memphis, Tennessee, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two incidents targeting towers in Memphis on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the attacks may have been carried out in relation to conspiracy theory regarding the link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities suspected that the incident may have been motivated by a conspiracy theory suggesting an unsubstantiated link between 5G radio waves and the COVID-19 pandemic.

Summary: 12/06/2019: A member of the Saudi Air Force, identified as Mohammed Saeed Alshamrani, opened fire on a classroom in the Naval Air Base in Pensacola, Florida, United States. Four people, including the assailant, were killed and eight others were injured in the attack. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the incident. Alshamrani posted criticism of U.S. wars and quoted Osama bin Laden on social media hours before the attack.
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that prior to the attack, Mohammed Saeed Alshamrani made social media posts criticizing the United States government for its support of Israel and for carrying out "crimes against Muslims." He also quoted Osama Bin Laden.

Summary: 12/07/2019: An assailant ambushed and opened fire on Stephen Carr, a police officer, outside a police station along west Rock street in Fayetteville, Arkansas, United States. Carr was killed instantly and the assailant was killed by police responding to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as an anti-police extremist and sources noted he was "looking for an officer to kill."
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that London Philips, an unaffiliated individual, demonstrated an interest in anti-law enforcement groups on social media, and that he was "looking for an officer to kill."

Summary: 12/10/2019: Two assailants opened fire on JC Kosher Supermarket in Jersey City, New Jersey, United States. In addition to the assailants, three people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. David Anderson and Francine Graham, Anti-Semitic extremists, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote in a note later discovered in the their vehicle, "I do this because my creator makes me do this and I hate who he hates." Sources noted that Anderson and Graham had both anti-Semitic and anti-police motivations and that Anderson had previously been linked to the Black Hebrew Israelite movement. Anderson and Graham were also responsible for the death of Detective Joseph Seals earlier that day along with the murder of Michael Rumberger, a taxi driver, in Bayonne, New Jersey the previous weekend.
Motive: David Anderson and Francine Graham claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote in a note later discovered in the their vehicle, "I do this because my creator makes me do this and I hate who he hates." Sources noted that Anderson and Graham had both anti-Semitic and anti-police motivations and that Anderson had previously been linked to the Black Hebrew Israelite movement.

Summary: 12/11/2019: An assailant set fire to the Church of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Franklin Lakes, Bergen County, New Jersey, United States. The assailant was injured and there were no other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident and sources identified the assailant as James Mayers.

12/22/2019: Assailants set fire to the executive building of the Spirit Filled Ambassadors for Christ, a primarily African American church, in Andrews, South Carolina, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/25/2019: An assailant set fire to the Solid Rock Baptist Church along Highway 115 in Cleveland, Georgia, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an individual identified as Clint Vance.

12/28/2019: An assailant, armed with a machete, attacked the residence of a rabbi, Chaim Rottenberg, while he and his guests were celebrating the seventh night of Hanukkah in Monsey, New York, United States. Five people were injured in the attack, and one victim died of his injuries on March 29, 2020. Grafton E. Thomas was arrested in connection to the attack and authorities discovered in his journal that he had referenced Hitler, "Nazi culture," and stated that "Hebrew Israelites" had taken from "powerful ppl (ebinoid Israelites)." He had also searched online for "why did Hitler hate the Jews," "prominent companies founded by Jews in America" and "German Jewish Temples near me."
Motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities discovered references to Hitler and "Nazi culture," and writings stating that "Hebrew Israelites" had taken from "powerful ppl (ebinoid Israelites)" in Grafton E. Thomas's journal. He had also searched online for "why did Hitler hate the Jews," "prominent companies founded by Jews in America" and "German Jewish Temples near me."
